These activists are facing up to 48 years in prison for organizing peaceful anti-racist demonstrations in Denver, CO. Now they’re speaking out about the D.A.’s ...

item.title: “We’ve recovered our democracy”: Bolivian coup regime...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

“We’ve recovered our democracy”: Bolivian coup regime humiliated as socialist wins landslide election

The Bolivian people stood up to vote for sovereignty and regain their democracy. This is a humiliating blow to the far-right regime of coup-installed president Jeanine Áñez and is being celebrated by the left across Latin America. #Bolivia #coup #latinamerica

item.title: Listen to the Unauthorized Disclosure interview with Lillian...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Listen to the Unauthorized Disclosure interview with Lillian House, targeted anti-racist organizer in Denver.

Hosts Rania Khalek and Kevin Gosztola are joined by Lillian, who is one of the Denver organizers targeted in militarized police raids and charged with political offenses for their involvement in anti-racist protests in Colorado sparked by the death of Elijah McClain, who was killed by Aurora police.

She, Joel Northam, and Eliza Lucero, all organizers with the PSL, we...re held for over a week in jail in conditions she describes as unsafe and inhumane.

A district attorney has charged the activists with "felony charges of kidnapping and rioting," as well as misdemeanors like "disturbing the peace."

#DropTheChargesCO

See MoreOfficial Post from Rania Khalek and Kevin Gosztola

patreon.com

item.title: “The idea that homelessness is caused by a moral failure on...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

“The idea that homelessness is caused by a moral failure on the part of the poor is nothing but a cover-up for this system's own failure to meet the needs of the people.

To eradicate homelessness, all the leaders of this country or this city would need to do is open up some of the ample housing that already exists and is just sitting empty to those who are in need. We have the resources! The problem is that this system and the people in power within it believe that the right to profit is more important than the right of people to have shelter. And that is why we organize, and that is why we fight. We demand HOUSING, not sweeps!”

PSL member Claire breaks it down at the Denver Homeless Out Loud four-day Race and Homelessness Vigil. 5256 minutes stationed in front of City Hall for every person of color who is homeless in Denver.
item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

item.title: What’s a better birthday present than to help make sure...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

What’s a better birthday present than to help make sure Lillian and the comrades remain free? Lillian is facing 24 charges in retaliation for her leadership in the movement for #JusticeforElijahMcClain, including 12 felonies, which could carry a sentence of 48 years in prison.

Donate to the legal and political support fund at pslweb.org/donate4denver or on Venmo @donate4denver.

In a poll of high school students across California, Gloria La Riva and the PSL ticket came in 3rd with over 5% of the vote! Look for the PSL on your Colorado presidential ballot, and spread the word about our socialist program. lariva2020.org

item.title: Inspiring support from the Retail, Wholesale, and Department...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Inspiring support from the Retail, Wholesale, and Department Store Union (RWDSU) for the organizers arrested and facing charges in Denver. This union has existed for more than 80 years and has organized tens of thousands of workers in the 21st century.

Sign on and learn more at: https://tradeunionists4justice.org/

Retail, Wholesale and Department Store Union (RWDSU)

STATEMENT: "We stand in solidarity with the Denver Area Labor Federation in their calling on District Attorneys Dave Young and George Brauchler to drop the char...ges against recently arrested organizers. The charges against these peaceful protesters is an attack on our democratic rights, similar to this administration's attacks on labor rights for workers across the country," said Stuart Appelbaum President of the Retail, Wholesale and Department Store Union (RWDSU). Learn more about this issue at: https://tradeunionists4justice.org/

item.title: We are honored to share this statement of solidarity from the...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

We are honored to share this statement of solidarity from the Denver Justice & Peace Committee!

*** If you haven't already, please sign on to the petition and solidarity statement demanding that charges against anti-racist organizers be dropped! Links below. ***

Statement:

...

"The Denver Justice & Peace Committee (DJPC) stands in solidarity with the six racial justice organizers who were arrested on September 17. Over the summer, these organizers sought to hold the Aurora police department accountable for the killing of Elijah McClain by holding marches and demonstrations. Some thirty charges have been made against them, ranging from misdemeanors to “inciting riots” and kidnapping, which could mean years in prison.

It is clear that these arrests, coordinated by the Arapahoe County and Adams County District Attorneys, are aimed at intimidating organizers and silencing the movement for racial justice. In dramatic fashion, one organizer was surrounded by five police cars while driving. In another case, a SWAT team swooped down to arrest the organizer in his home. The arrests appear intended to repress political speech, as four of the people arrested are vocal critics of District Attorney Young, members of the Party for Socialism and Liberation, and advocates for racial justice.

We understand that this can happen to any protester, who has used their voice to mobilize in the mass movement against racism in every corner of the United States. We stand united against this attack on civil liberties and the ongoing movement for Black Lives.

At the same time, violations by counter protesters are often ignored. On May 3, Aurora police ignored serious aggressions made against an in-car protest against immigrant detention during a Covid-19 outbreak at the ICE Processing Center. Counter protestors could be seen in videos blocking traffic, attacking activists’ cars, shouting obscenities, and ripping signs from the cars. These acts were witnessed by police in the area who did nothing.

We feel it is particularly important to stand with the falsely accused protesters, as the attack on their First Amendment rights is the first step in cracking down on everyone’s rights, especially the rights of Black, indigenous, Latinx, working class, and other traditionally marginalized communities.

In light of these events:

* We demand an end to the targeting of the racial justice movement for intimidation and abuse.
* We demand the arrest of those responsible for the killing of Elijah McClain as he walked home from a convenience store in 2019.
* We call on everyone to join the struggle to end police brutality, build our communities, and achieve racial justice!
* We demand an end to all attempts to silence speech and crush the movement for Black Lives.

In solidarity,

The DJPC team
October 1, 2020"

SIGN ON TO THE SOLIDARITY STATEMENT:
https://www.pslweb.org/denverorgsolidarity

SIGN THE PETITION:
https://www.pslweb.org/dropthecharges

See More

item.title: Party for Socialism and Liberation - DenverParty for Socialism and Liberation - PSLToday is Indigenous People’s Day, a celebration of the...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - DenverParty for Socialism and Liberation - PSL

Today is Indigenous People’s Day, a celebration of the long history of Indigenous resistance and solidarity with oppressed peoples the world over. This recognit...ion results from grassroots struggle to reclaim history for the people.

European colonizers arrived to the land now known as the Americas more than 500 years ago. This marked the beginning of the brutal pillage and enslavement of entire continents of people. Holidays which commemorate Christopher Columbus whitewash the genocide they spearheaded.

The passage of time does not guarantee progress. After centuries of exploitation, Indigenous people in the United States face very high rates of poverty, sickness, incarceration, and theft of natural resources.

Take the example of Pine Ridge reservation in South Dakota. Pine Ridge is the site of the Wounded Knee Massacre of 1890, where U.S. soldiers murdered hundreds of Plains Native Americans, including children, women and men.

Today, the brutality continues but with silent causes. The area has the highest infant mortality rate in the country — 300 percent the national average.

Life expectancy for men on the reservation is just 48 years, and for women, 52 years.

It was within this context that on Feb. 27, 1973, the American Indian Movement began the 71-day occupation of Wounded Knee to spread awareness of historical and ongoing injustices to Indigenous people.

The U.S. government waged all-out war against AIM.

Just as they set out to destroy the Black Panthers and others, the FBI was determined to kill, imprison Native liberation leaders. They falsified evidence to unjustly convict AIM organizer Leonard Peltier, resulting in two life sentences.

Held at a maximum security prison in Florida, for 44 years Peltier is being deprived of necessary facilities and is seeking compassionate release or commutation of his Free Leonard Peltier! Free all political prisoners!

Many countries in Latin America had similar colonial-born holidays marking the anniversary of their conquest. On his third voyage in 1498, Columbus planted the flag of Spain in present-day Venezuela.

The 1999 election of Hugo Chavez to presidency sparked the beginning of the Bolivarian Movement that nationalized the country’s oil and created major social programs that lifted millions out of poverty.

In 2002 Chávez declared Oct 12 as Día de la Resistencia Indígena, the Day of Indigenous Resistance. Columbus’ statue was torn down two years later and the colonizer was tried in a court of public justice. Today not a single statue of Columbus remains.

Long live Indigenous resistance! Long live the struggle for liberation!

#IndigenousPeoplesDay2020

See More
item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

item.title: A must-read on this Indigenous Peoples’ Day:...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

A must-read on this Indigenous Peoples’ Day: https://liberationschool.org/the-legacy-of-christopher-col…/

To celebrate Columbus is to celebrate a legacy of genocide, slavery, rape and plunder. It commemorates the violent and bloody accumulation of capital for the ruling classes of Europe and, later, the US. Celebrate #IndigenousPeoplesDay

The second Monday of October is Columbus Day, celebrated as a federal holiday in the U.S. since 1971. This day marks the anniversary of Christopher Columbus’s 1492 landing in the Americas, his “discovery of the New World” for the benefit of the Spanish monarchy. Columbus Day is a day of parade...

liberationschool.org

The real legacy of Christopher Columbus: slavery and genocide

The second Monday of October is Columbus Day, celebrated as a federal holiday in the U.S. since 1971. This day marks the anniversary of Christopher Columbus’s 1492 landing in the Americas, his “discovery of the New World” for the benefit of the Spanish monarchy. item.title: Lillian House, author of this article and one of the recently...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Lillian House, author of this article and one of the recently arrested Denver anti-racist organizers: "I thought a lot about the disturbing research I did for this article while I was in jail, experiencing firsthand the terrifying and total control the cops wield over you when you’re locked under their custody.

It’s staggering to think that there are ~1.2 million women behind bars or under the control of a parole or probation officer in this country, and more coming into contact with the cops every day, and all of them are entirely vulnerable to the countless predators harbored by this sham of a 'justice system'."

Women have long testified to a culture of rampant abuse in jails and prisons, under police custody, that suggests the U.S. justice system as a whole functions as a sanctuary for abuse.

liberationschool.org

The U.S. “justice system:” Sanctuaries of sexual abuse

Women have long testified to a culture of rampant abuse in jails and prisons, under police custody, that suggests the U.S. justice system as a whole functions as a sanctuary for abuse.Women have long testified to a culture of rampant abuse in jails and prisons, under police custody, that suggests the U.S. justice system as a whole functions as a sanctuary for abuse.

item.title: While billionaires are doing better than ever, and the job...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

While billionaires are doing better than ever, and the job market for highly paid professionals has fully recovered, the lower-paid sectors of the working class continue to be devastated by the worst economic crisis since the Great Depression.

Movie theater chain Regal Cinemas announced today that they would be firing 20,000 workers as they close down all 536 of their locations in the United States, citing lost income because of the pandemic. Regal is the second largest cinema chain in the country, and... #economy #unemployment #Workers

liberationnews.org

Layoffs pile up as corporate giants announce mass firings

Movie theater chain Regal Cinemas announced today that they would be firing 20,000 workers as they close down all 536 of their locations in the United States, citing lost income because of the pandemic. item.title: DROP ALL THE CHARGES ON ANTI-RACIST ORGANIZERS IN THE DENVER...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

DROP ALL THE CHARGES ON ANTI-RACIST ORGANIZERS IN THE DENVER AREA! - HOW YOU CAN HELP

On Sept. 17, police agencies in the Denver area arrested anti-racist organizers in a coordinated assault. People were arrested in a Home Depot parking lot, at their homes, and after they were pulled over while driving. Those arrested were the leaders to demand justice for Elijah McClain, who was brutally murdered by the Aurora Police Department. They are still in jail, with the exception of ...one person. They are facing multiple felony charges and years in prison in an obvious frame-up aimed at stopping the movement for justice for Elijah McClain.

Add your name to sign the petition and join the campaign to demand that all the charges be dropped!

Petition text:

"I demand that all charges be dropped on anti-racist organizers in the Denver area. It is an obvious political frame-up aimed at stopping the movement for justice for Elijah McClain."

You can also donate for legal and political support for the PSL organizers who were arrested: pslweb.org/donate4denver

If you are a community leader or a member of an organization you can sign our solidarity statement: pslweb.org/denverorgsolidarity

If you can support in person, you can join our emergency demonstration demanding the dropping off all charges: https://facebook.com/events/s/dropthechargesco-march-and-ral/775179416359489/?ti=icl
